Document.title: Document
Document.description: Represents a document uploaded to the system, such as a PDF course description, lab manual, or past paper.

filename.description: The original filename of the uploaded document.

uploadDate.description: The date and time when the document was uploaded.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the uploaded document (e.g., 'application/pdf').

storageLocation.description: The location where the document is stored (e.g., a file path or cloud storage URL).  This assumes the file is available on the backend.

title.description: The title of the document as extracted from the file metadata or content.

description.description: A user-provided description of the document's content and purpose.

definition.description: Stores all uploaded documents.  No explicit ownership as documents are managed by the backend.

params.name: documentId
params.description: The unique identifier for the document.

firestore.reasoning: The data structure prioritizes simplicity and security for storing academic documents. All documents are stored in a single `documents` collection, which avoids complex authorization logic and supports efficient retrieval. There is no ownership in this design as the documents are pre-uploaded and available in the backend. This achieves authorization independence since every document has the same security posture. The `documents` collection enables secure `list` operations since all documents share the same security requirements and there is no need for filtering based on access control.
